item.title: 独家消息消息人士称，TikTok 正准备在美国复制该应用的核心算法
item.description: 据直接知情人士透露，TikTok 正在为其 1.7 亿美国用户开发克隆版推荐算法，该版本可能会独立于其中国母公司运行，更容易被美国立法者接受，因为美国立法者希望禁止该算法。【原文：TikTok is working on a clone of its recommendation algorithm for its 170 million U.S. users that may result in a version that operates independently of its Chinese parent and be more palatable to American lawmakers who want to ban it, according to sources with direct knowledge of the efforts.】

item.title: 雷诺将与中国合作伙伴开发售价低于 20,000 欧元的 Twingos 汽车
item.description: 雷诺表示，它将与一家中国工程公司合作开发未来售价低于20,000欧元（21,676美元）的Twingo汽车，因为欧洲汽车制造商的目标是生产更小、更便宜的电动汽车，以与中国同行竞争。【原文：Renault said it would link up with a Chinese engineering company to develop future Twingo cars priced below 20,000 euros ($21,676), as European automakers target smaller and cheaper electric vehicles to compete with Chinese peers.】

item.title: 智利国家矿业公司（ENAMI）计划在 2028 年前破土动工首个锂项目
item.description: 智利国家矿业公司ENAMI首席执行官伊万-姆利纳兹（Ivan Mlynarz）告诉路透社，该公司的目标是最快于2027年或2028年开始建设其在智利的第一个锂项目。【原文：Chile's state mining firm ENAMI aims to start construction on its first lithium project in the country as soon as 2027 or 2028, company chief Ivan Mlynarz told Reuters, part of the government's push to boost its role in production of the battery metal.】

item.title: 消息人士称，Skydance 对派拉蒙全球的收购要约更加优惠
item.description: 据一位熟知内情的人士透露，Skydance Media 已向派拉蒙全球公司提交了一份更优惠的报价。【原文：Skydance Media has submitted a sweetened offer for Paramount Global , according to a person familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 沙特阿拉伯将出售 0.64% 的阿美石油公司股份
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯正在出售石油巨头阿美石油公司（Aramco）0.64% 的股份，以推进王储穆罕默德-本-萨勒曼（Mohammed bin Salman）的经济多元化计划。【原文：Saudi Arabia is selling a 0.64% stake in oil giant Aramco as the kingdom pushes ahead with Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman's plan to diversify the economy.】

item.title: OpenAI 制止了五起滥用其人工智能进行 "欺骗活动 "的企图
item.description: 萨姆-奥特曼领导的 OpenAI 公司周四表示，该公司已经破坏了五项秘密影响行动，这些行动试图利用其人工智能模型在互联网上进行 "欺骗活动"。【原文：Sam Altman-led OpenAI said on Thursday it had disrupted five covert influence operations that sought to use its artificial intelligence models for "deceptive activity" across the internet.】

item.title: 经济学人》报道：OpenAI 回应前董事会成员关于自我治理的警告
item.description: OpenAI 董事会周四回击了其前成员的指控，即由于担心初创公司的人工智能安全问题，萨姆-阿尔特曼（Sam Altman）才不得不在去年令人震惊地下台。【原文：OpenAI's board on Thursday pushed back on allegations from its former members that concerns over artificial intelligence safety at the startup necessitated Sam Altman's shocking ouster last year.】

item.title: 美联储主席古尔斯比称，失业率不上升，通胀率仍可能下降
item.description: 芝加哥联储主席奥斯坦-古尔斯比（Austan Goolsbee）周四表示，美国联邦储备委员会官员正在 "努力想清楚"，通胀的进一步改善是否需要更高的失业率，而不是来自供应链改善和其他能够自行降低价格压力的力量的帮助。【原文：U.S. Federal Reserve officials are "trying to wrap their head around" whether further improvement in inflation will require higher unemployment, with less help coming from improved supply chains and other forces that can lower price pressures on their own, Chicago Fed President Austan Goolsbee said on Thursday.】

item.title: 美国联邦航空局称美联航可以接收交付的新飞机
item.description: 美国联邦航空管理局（Federal Aviation Administration）局长周四表示，美国联合航空公司（United Airlines）可以接收新飞机，因为美国航空监管机构正在对该航空公司进行审查。【原文：United Airlines can take delivery of new airplanes as U.S. aviation regulators review the carrier, the head of the Federal Aviation Administration said Thursday.】

item.title: 法院文件显示，美国劳工部起诉现代汽车使用童工
item.description: 美国劳工部周四起诉韩国汽车业巨头现代汽车公司、一家汽车零部件工厂和一家劳务招聘公司，指控其在阿拉巴马州非法使用童工。【原文：The U.S. Department of Labor on Thursday sued South Korean auto giant Hyundai Motor Co , an auto parts plant and a labor recruiter, over illegal use of child labor in Alabama.】

item.title: 美国银行首席执行官预计第二季度投资银行业务收费将增长 10%至 15
item.description: 美国银行首席执行官布莱恩-莫伊尼汉（Brian Moynihan）周四表示，由于市场波动、利率上升和地缘政治动荡，美国银行的投资银行业务在经历了近两年的行业低迷之后，预计第二季度的收费将比去年同期增长 10%至 15%。【原文：Bank of America's investment banking fees are expected to rise 10% to 15% in the second quarter from a year earlier, CEO Brian Moynihan said on Thursday, after an almost two-year industry slump due to market volatility, rising interest rates and geopolitical turmoil.】

item.title: 华尔街交易失败率在加快结算后基本保持稳定
item.description: 美国存管信托清算公司（DTCC）今晨公布的数据显示，周三是最近实施的更快结算周期的重要测试日，当天美国交易失败率为 1.90%，与上周五的数字基本持平。【原文：The rate of U.S. failed trades stood at 1.90% on Wednesday, a big test day for the recently implemented faster settlement cycle, roughly stable from Friday's number, Depository Trust & Clearing Corporation (DTCC) showed this morning.】

item.title: 各国政府寻求在 6 月底前挽救全球税收协议
item.description: 在巴黎举行的为期三天的会议未能达成协议，会议共同主席周四表示，近 130 个国家再次承诺在 6 月底之前挽救针对高利润跨国公司的全球税收协议的第一支柱。【原文：Nearly 130 countries recommitted on Thursday to save the first pillar of a global tax deal on highly profitable multinationals by the end of June, the co-chairs of a three-day meeting in Paris said after the talks failed to produce an agreement.】

item.title: 芝加哥商品交易所集团调查标准普尔和道琼斯指数市场数据问题
item.description: 芝加哥商品交易所集团周四表示，它正在调查一个影响 S&P 和道琼斯指数市场数据的问题。【原文：Exchange CME Group said on Thursday it was investigating an issue affecting the market data for the S&P and Dow Jones indexes.】

item.title: 美联储威廉姆斯：货币政策已做好降低通胀的准备
item.description: 纽约联邦储备银行行长约翰-威廉姆斯（John Williams）周四表示，目前的货币政策设置正处于帮助通胀率重返2%的正确位置，他在讲话中没有暗示央行何时能够削减短期借贷成本。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of New York President John Williams said Thursday the current setting of monetary policy is in the right place to help inflation get back to 2%, in remarks that gave no hints of when he thinks the central bank might be able to cut the cost of short-term borrowing.】

item.title: 欧盟批准 KKR 240 亿美元的意大利电信固网交易
item.description: 欧盟反垄断监管机构周四无条件批准了美国投资公司 KKR 以 220 亿欧元（240 亿美元）收购意大利电信公司（TIM）固网的交易。【原文：EU antitrust regulators gave unconditional approval on Thursday to U.S. investment firm KKR's 22-billion-euro ($24 billion) acquisition of Telecom Italia's (TIM) fixed-line network.】

item.title: 福特首席执行官表示，混合动力汽车不仅仅是通往电动汽车的桥梁
item.description: 福特公司首席执行官吉姆-法利（Jim Farley）希望汽车行业不要再把混合动力汽车仅仅看作是一种临时解决方案，直到驾驶者能够适应完全电动化为止。【原文：Ford CEO Jim Farley wants the industry to stop viewing hybrid vehicles as only an interim solution to be used until drivers are comfortable going fully electric.】

item.title: 瑞银重组，埃尔莫蒂的潜在继任者重新洗牌
item.description: 瑞银集团（UBS）周四宣布对高级管理层进行调整，将其最高财富管理职位分给两位高管，他们都被视为首席执行官塞尔吉奥-埃尔莫蒂（Sergio Ermotti）的潜在继任者。【原文：UBS on Thursday announced a shake-up of its senior management, splitting its top wealth role between two executives who are both seen as potential successors to CEO Sergio Ermotti.】

item.title: 埃隆-马斯克将在美国证券交易委员会对推特股票披露的调查中作证
item.description: 据周四的一份法庭文件显示，埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）已解决了他与美国证券交易委员会（U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission）的最新法律纠纷，同意为监管机构调查他在 2022 年收购社交媒体网站 Twitter 一案作证。【原文：Elon Musk has settled his latest legal fight with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission by agreeing to testify for the regulator's probe into his 2022 acquisition of social media site Twitter, according to a Thursday court filing.】

item.title: 法院称 WeWork 已获准退出破产程序并削减 40 亿美元债务
item.description: 美国破产法官周四批准了 WeWork 的破产保护计划，允许这家共享办公空间提供商免除 40 亿美元的债务，并将公司股权移交给一组贷款人和房地产技术公司 Yardi Systems。【原文：A U.S. bankruptcy judge on Thursday approved WeWork's Chapter 11 bankruptcy plan, allowing the shared office space provider to eliminate $4 billion in debt and hand the company's equity over to a group of lenders and real estate technology company Yardi Systems.】

item.title: 美国未决房屋销售创三年来最大降幅
item.description: 美国全国房地产经纪人协会（National Association of Realtors）周四表示，由于高利率压制了房地产市场，4月份美国购房合同签署量创下三年来最大降幅，整体活动水平也创下了自2020年春季COVID-19大流行以来的最低水平。【原文：Contract signings for U.S. home purchases fell by the most in three years in April and the overall level of activity was the lowest since the onset of the COVID-19 pandemic in the spring of 2020, as high interest rates keep a lid on the housing market, the National Association of Realtors said on Thursday.】

item.title: 主要科技公司制定人工智能网络标准，但主要参与者英伟达缺席
item.description: 包括 Meta、微软、先进微设备公司（Advanced Micro Devices）和博通（Broadcom）在内的大型科技公司周四表示，他们已经为人工智能数据中心的网络连接制定了新的行业标准，这是为打破市场领导者英伟达（Nvidia）的主导地位而做出的最新努力。【原文：Major tech firms, including Meta , Microsoft , Advanced Micro Devices and Broadcom , said on Thursday they have developed a new industry standard for networking in AI data centers, the latest effort to break the dominance of market leader Nvidia .】

item.title: 民主党参议员要求调查欧佩克与石油行业勾结的指控
item.description: 美国参议院多数党领袖查克-舒默（Chuck Schumer）和其他 22 位民主党参议员周四要求司法部长调查有关石油行业与石油输出国组织（OPEC）串通和操纵价格的指控。【原文：U.S. Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer and 22 other Democratic Senators on Thursday asked the Attorney General to investigate allegations of collusion and price fixing between the oil industry and the Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC).】

item.title: 美国房价今年将上涨 5%，明年涨幅将更加温和
item.description: 路透社调查的分析师认为，由于可用供应有限，今年美国房价的上涨速度将略高于此前的预期。【原文：U.S. home prices will rise a bit faster this year than previously expected due to limited available supply, according to analysts polled by Reuters, who saw affordable properties coming to market remaining below levels of demand in coming years.】

item.title: 国际金融协会（IIF）称，2024 年流向新兴市场的资本净额将达 9030 亿美元
item.description: 银行业贸易组织的一份报告称，预计今年主要发展中经济体的净资本流入量将增加近三分之一，达到 9030 亿美元，但这在很大程度上取决于全球经济能否保持增长。【原文：Major developing economies are expected to see net capital inflows this year rise by nearly a third to $903 billion, though much of that hinges on global growth holding up, a banking trade group report said.】

item.title: 美国钢铁公司和新日本制铁公司获得所有非美国监管机构批准
item.description: 美国钢铁公司（United States Steel Corp）和新日本制铁公司（Nippon Steel）周四表示，他们已获得美国境外所有监管机构对其拟议的 149 亿美元合并案的批准。【原文：United States Steel Corp and Nippon Steel said on Thursday they had received all regulatory approvals outside of the United States related to their proposed $14.9 billion merger.】

item.title: 增税为俄罗斯进一步增加支出提供财政空间
item.description: 俄罗斯拟对公司和富人增税，这可能会使明年的预算收入额外增加 300 亿美元，这将使莫斯科能够在不影响财政稳定的情况下进一步增加支出，包括用于乌克兰战争的支出。【原文：Russia's proposed tax hikes for companies and the wealthy, which may add an extra $30 billion to next year's budget revenues, will allow Moscow to further ratchet up spending, including on its war in Ukraine, without compromising fiscal stability.】

item.title: 美国第一季度经济增长下调
item.description: 美国商务部周四发布报告称，在对消费者支出进行下调后，美国第一季度的经济增长速度比之前估计的要慢。【原文：The U.S. economy grew more slowly in the first quarter than previously estimated after downward revisions to consumer spending, the Commerce Department reported on Thursday.】

item.title: 美国最近一周每周申请失业救济人数增加
item.description: 上周新申请失业救济的美国人数量有所上升，但劳动力市场的基本优势仍有持续迹象，应能继续支撑经济。【原文：The number of Americans filing new claims for unemployment benefits ticked higher last week, but underlying strength in the labor market still shows signs of persisting and should continue to support the economy.】

item.title: 独家报道：谷歌与增强现实初创公司 Magic Leap 达成合作协议
item.description: Alphabet 旗下的谷歌公司和增强现实初创公司 Magic Leap 正在建立战略技术合作伙伴关系，并致力于打造融合物理世界和数字世界的沉浸式体验。【原文：Alphabet's Google and augmented reality startup Magic Leap are forming a strategic technology partnership and working on building immersive experiences that blend the physical and digital worlds.】
